property.name: displayText
property.value: "IMPORTANT! Web content here. Double click -> Configure to edit. Web page script to run on containers icon."

property.name: script
startText
property.value:
Offline data Online data

Please select a:

start date: start time: (millisec:)
end date: end time: (millisec:)
(Note: Latest online data is from 6 months ago)

Click on each building for a detailed energy consumption graph!

property.name: jQueryLibraries
property.value:
<!-- Styling for datepicker. See http://jqueryui.com/datepicker/ --> <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://code.jquery.com/ui/1.10.0/themes/base/jquery-ui.css" />
<!-- Source for datepicker. See http://jqueryui.com/datepicker/ --> <script src="http://code.jquery.com/ui/1.10.0/jquery-ui.js"></script>

property.name: text
property.value: This model reads data on power consumption per square foot for three buildings on the Berkeley campus from a web service (or optionally from local files that cache the data) and renders a visualization of the power consumption over time as color changes on the buildings. The color is more red for larger power consumption per square foot, and more green for less.

property.name: text
property.value:
Start and end dates for the query, in standard Unix milliseonds The offline dates correspond to May 16, 2012 and May 17, 2012
Start and end days for the date range annotation at the top of the map
True to use online data; false to use data file in Ptolemy repository
In the future, want to add capability to show data in different formats (e.g. graph, text). We can use a parameter as input to a Switch so that the model only fires one of the sink actors. The value of this parameter will be input from the web page. Currently, the web page does not offer a way to set this (creating an input element is easy, but it requires some work to generate the correct response page).

property.name: text
property.value: DefaultIconAttribute specifying web content (here, date pickers, date form, and pop-up box libraries) to show as part of the generated web page.

property.name: text
property.value: Actor-oriented class definition for the colored circle actors on the campus map

property.name: text
property.value: ID numbers of the building data feeds on the sMAP website

property.name: text
property.value: Set the date range at the top of the map

property.name: text
property.value: This class reads power consumption data, from either an online or offline source, and changes the color of the class's circle icon (green: low readings, red: high readings) Based on Michael Wetter's BCVTB demos ptolemy-room/systemVisual and www-weather

property.name: text
property.value: Since the start and end times are longs, Ptolemy inserts an L following each number Unfortunately the L causes an error for the new.openbms.org website. Remove these Ls in the URI. The URI does not contain any other Ls, so we can remove all Ls.

entity.doc: Read an entire file and output as a string

entity.name: OnlineDataFileReader
entity.doc: Read an entire file and output as a string

entity.name: IterateOverArray
entity.doc: Iterate a contained actor over input arrays

svg.text: Get the second element in the array (index 1), which is the sensor value. The first is the time.
Choose a color based on the reading.

entity.name: StringReplace
entity.doc: Replace the patterns that match a regular expression
